revised_title: Investigating the Sensitivity of Water-Amino Acid Interactions in Computer Simulations
tldr: The authors conducted Monte Carlo computer simulations to study the sensitivity of water-amino acid interactions using the polarizable electropole model. They found that predicted water structures were highly sensitive to the input parameters used to define non-bonded and electrostatic interactions. The study highlights the importance of investigating potential functions and their parameters for accurate predictions of solvent organization in complex water-protein systems.
